title: 106_hr5278
content: The Act may be cited as the "Energy Independence Through Presidential Leadership Act" and focuses on Presidential leadership to enact comprehensive energy policy. The Congress finds that the United States increasingly depends on foreign nations for energy, making it vulnerable to national security threats. Lessening this dependence requires a comprehensive energy policy focused on increasing domestic energy production and refining capacity. The Congress emphasizes the need for a comprehensive energy policy to reduce dependence on foreign nations for energy. This policy includes environmental guidelines, diplomatic pressure on oil-producing countries, energy efficiency improvements, increased use of renewable energy sources, and tax reforms. Congress and the President should provide relief for consumers affected by high gasoline prices. The President should take immediate action to develop a comprehensive energy policy to reduce dependence on foreign nations for energy supply. SEC. 3. IMMEDIATE CONSUMER RELIEF THROUGH REPEAL OF DEFICIT REDUCTION TAX. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to reduce taxes on highway gasoline and diesel fuel. Gasoline tax is reduced from 18.3 cents to 14 cents, and diesel fuel tax is reduced from 24.3 cents to 20 cents. Technical amendments are also made to certain sections of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to reduce taxes on highway gasoline and diesel fuel. Gasoline tax is reduced from 18.3 cents to 14 cents, and diesel fuel tax is reduced from 24.3 cents to 20 cents. Amendments include changing tax rates and effective dates for the reductions. The tax paid on liquid held by a dealer for sale can be credited or refunded to the taxpayer. Claims for credit or refund must be filed within 6 months of the enactment of the Act. The taxpayer can claim a credit or refund for tax paid on liquid held by a dealer, as long as it is done within 3 months of enactment. No credit or refund is allowed for liquid held in retail stocks. Definitions for "dealer" and "held by a dealer" are based on section 6412 of the Code. Rules similar to section 6412 apply. For tax purposes, subsections (b) and (c) of section 6412 of the Code apply to this subsection.
